description:
Such a good coffee!!!
Nice atmosphere and friendly staff!
Now,it's my favorite coffee place 
Thank you )
author: Kamilia A.

description:
Wow, would not normally review for a single visit, but the latte was remarkable. I like to judge a place on how it handles basics -- in coffee shops, I try espressos, lattes, cold brews... The latte here is excellent! I would definitely come back to try their other drinks if I'm ever in the neighborhood again.

I really appreciate the vibe of the store as well. You can see the roasting machine from the front, and the character of the operating family really comes through in their decor and design (recently renovated?) --- clean and modern.
author: Billy H.

description:
Want to enjoy some coffee and get work done in SF? Henry's House of Coffee has great Wi-Fi, plenty of plugs, and great coffee as well. Can't beat that combo. The place is spacious unlike many other cafes in the SF Bay Area.

I'd recommend Henry's.
author: Carlos H.

description: The zaatar was ok.   The cold brew was really good. I enjoyed the flavors - smelled great. It was also very refreshing.  Service is great, nice people. Cool vibe and nice place to do some work.
author: Rachelle C.

description:
Henry's is pretty close to where I live and they just recently remodeled their coffee shop. I needed some coffee in the morning and decided to get some Espresso from here. I came on a Wednesday and there were people outside chatting and people inside doing work. The cashiers were friendly and the Espresso was great. For $2.50, it's a steal! 

The prices here are really reasonable and I was in and out in like a minute. They do accept Apple Pay here which is really convenient for me. I believe they also roast their own coffee on site and you can smell the great coffee aroma once you enter. 

I like Henry's because street parking is easy to find and I can get a jump on my day pretty fast. But if you want to sit, they also have that option and have pastries and breakfast items for you to enjoy.
author: Michael L.

description:
I came in for the first time on a late Monday afternoon and the shop was pretty empty, though I noticed quite a few people stopped in for togo orders. It's a cute spot and though I didn't test out the wifi, just based on table size and the volume level that day I think it'd be a good place to study or get some work done. 

I ordered a small mocha (hot) and really enjoyed it! The drink wasn't too bitter nor too sweet - it was honestly just right and definitely one of the better mochas I've had. On top of that, in comparison to other nearby coffee shops, the prices here are a bit lower which is great because coffee spending definitely adds up. 

Service was also really friendly!
author: Janice L.

description:
I found Henry's on Yelp, as I'm new to the neighborhood and still looking for the perfect coffee shop. I decided to stop by for a latte before a morning walk. The coffee was so fragrant I could smell it from 2 blocks away, and the shop - upon arriving - was so cute and cozy, I was sold! 

A medium latte is 3.75 which is reasonable. In addition to espresso drinks, they have some pretty delicious looking pastries and a breakfast burrito too. I will definitely have to come back for breakfast some day.
 
I started a punch card, as I'm sure I'll definitely be back soon.
author: Sherry L.

description: I only happened upon this place while wandering the sunset neighborhood when the urge for coffee kicked in. The coffee here is delicious. Very flavorful and you can tell it's really treated with love. They seem to roast their coffee on site and for such a small place makes a solid cup of coffee. They serve food and other espresso based drinks. The service here was friendly and welcoming, a very warm neighborhood joint type vibe which I liked. The only thing which is didn't like that I don't really blame the place is how small it is. Only like 4 tables and coming here thinking there's seating was not a good idea. I'd say more a coffee counter then an actual shop. Not a place to hang out or do work in. Overall really like the coffee and service here and theres ample parking outside. Next time I'm nearby with a caffeine craving I'll definitely come back here.
author: Peter P.

description:
Forget Starbucks. This is coffee prepared well, fresh, delicious without the bitterness or burnt flavor. Fast service. Lots of locals and regular customers who already know exactly what they want and have their money out ready to pay. I was impressed with the line filled by loyalty and dedicated customers. 

I ordered a cappuccino and a jalapeno cheese bread. The cappuccino was awesome! Creamy, great foam, and so good! I felt like I had a really good cup made with the best. 

There's limited seating but it's nice to people watch. If I lived in SF I would convert. :)
author: Mel H.

description:
I start my day by drinking a cup of Armenian coffee everyday and also a few more shots of Armenian coffee throughout the day! I have tried several different Armenian coffee in Los Angels but I have to admit none of those can beat Henry's house dark roast Armenian coffee! 

Two of my friends recommended Henry's House Coffee and I was very interested to give it a try. 
I checked their website and ordered half n half Armenian coffee and Dark Armenian coffee. 

Confessing that Henry's House Coffee is an expensive coffee, $17 for for a pack of coffee, it's kinda pricey; but worth giving it a try! 

The taste of dark one is pleasurably wonderful. Flavors that I am getting out of Henry's coffee are rich, fragrant, and blissfully smooth; even though it is dark but it's very smooth and no bitter taste (for Armenian coffee drinkers). 

Henry's House coffee takes the daily coffee ritual to a new heights. I highly recommend it!
author: Valentina S.

description:
We've been on the hunt for a good, third wave coffee shop to buy our beans from and we've finally found it~ Beans from Philz' for example lack quality -- they don't even have the roast dates on the bag and are just mass produced to cater to the hype. And many of the shops in SF overprice their beans or advertise a pound when they really sell it in 10-12oz quantities, lame. But behold!! We loved the beans we got from here AND it's actually a full 16oz

The female cashier was really informative about the pour overs and helped us picked 2 different ones, both of which we loved. We ended up getting a bag of their Gypsy(?) bean and have been doing our own pour overs at home. I'm wondering if our ratio is right though, we'll definitely need to ask next time. Also! Each bag purchase comes with a free brewed coffee I believe. The shop itself is small but we were lucky to grab 2 seats, they also have a variety of coffee gear to sell

Excited to stop by again in a couple weeks to try a new bean~
author: Nicolette E.

description:
First timer here and left very satisfied. Usually, when I have lunch in the Sunset District, I go to my usual tea spot, but my friend recommended we stop for coffee instead at Henry's. Which i wasn't opposed to since all the coffee shops in my area are chains.

The menu is easy and simple. I ordered a Medium Mocha. It was very pleasant, perfect blend of cocoa and coffee. Some places just cannot get it right. My friend went for the cold brew and also tasted great.

Love that it's a family run shop. I read more on their website about how they got started and I think it's great that father and son are working together on this. I heard it's newly renovated. The spacing is pretty small but warm and cozy. Very modern style.

My friend told me they roast coffee on that machine on the weekends? I'd love to come back try more coffee and see!
author: Mary R.

description: I love love coffee... And Henry's is one of the best I, if not the best I have tried. I had ordered Armenian coffee from them, and had to stop by when visited San Francisco! Mail orders are prompt, and the coffee is always fresh.
author: MARIAM M.

description:
Really nice and simple coffee shop! I've come here for the past couple of years, usually just to get coffee to go. But they remodeled the place recently and it's a lot nicer and the environment is more comfortable to sit and study! They have free WiFi and street parking all around! Their coffee prices are also a little cheaper than other places! My coffee was only $2.25

Compared to other coffee shops close by, like Home or Andytown, this one definitely isn't as hyped up. It doesn't have the fancy drinks like other places, but if you just want simple coffee this place is perfect! They also grind coffee every morning and it smells soo good haha. They were nonstop grinding coffee beans for bags people ordered for the 2 hours I was there.

The only downside to this place is that there's always people smoking outside, so the smoke was blowing into the coffee shop toward my table. 

But overall, simple coffee shop that's a good place to study at!
author: Patricia T.

description:
My gf and I absolutely love this shop. If you're a coffee snob or need a morning fix, go here. Small study space but enough to escape city life. Bring a book. Sometimes you'll see the owner here. 

Best coffee all around as we get:
Gypsy - bold and something. I just know it's good. 
Conquistador - bold and chocolate-y. 
Pour over grind. 

Prices are great, the beans are fresh that it creates a beautiful bloom in your pour over. If you buy a bag, you get a free brewed cup. Staff is extremely nice.
author: Kingston T.

description: It's simple and the coffee is delicious. Found it in a hurry when I was running to meet new friends who needed emergency coffee! But turned out to be a gem. Didn't wait very long for the coffee and cappuccino but loved the feel of the place and the coffee of course. This was the weekend so of course the come might be different during the week. Either way the coffee is good for when I'm in the neighborhood
author: Abhi K.

description:
Absolutely fantastic coffee, the aroma in this place is very soothing & relaxing. They make their coffee fresh everyday. The owners are great hard working people and they run a great coffee shop. If you're in the area, this is the place to get REAL
Coffee not watered down Starbucks!
author: Yuriy T.

description:
Amazing coffee! I moved up to SF for grad school, and needed to find a good coffeeshop where I could get my fix and ideally have a spot I could do work at - some friends recommended I check out Henry's and I've become a regular ever since.
- I personally love their hot lattes, cold brew, and chai latte.
- They have great pastries, bagel sandwiches, as well as some small bites - was excited to see some Armenian options as well (their zaatar brunch is my favorite!! Tastes just like what my family would make at home)
- It's a family run shop, you can catch Henry roasting coffee beans in store + his son comes by all the time and is always super friendly & helpful!
- Simple, clean coffeeshop, a few tables but I always manage to find seating, good wifi, good amount of outlets, friendly baristas. I come here at least once a week & stay for hours doing work!

Definitely my favorite neighborhood coffeeshop.
author: Nanor H.

description: Greattt place. Great coffee. Just how i like it--no frills. It jumptarts my day. The food options r limited to bakery goods and some hot foods (breakfast burritos, and bagels). Service is terrific and quick. Seating is limited, but i could stay there for hours happily. Keep up the great work.
author: Emily C.

description:
Still a great spot to get a solid cup of coffee.

Some new news 
*Henry just remodeled!
*They now serve Anderson baked goods 
*When you buy some beans they now offer you a cup of coffee (just like Peet's)
*don't forget to take advantage of their stamp cards ;)

Thanks Henry!
author: Liz N.

description:
Place - Here small cafe. It might be difficult to see its back sign board. There are 4 tables inside and many sockets! I can use it at any tables. Many people visit to take out coffee.

Taste - I just oredered iced coffee today. It was really good. I guess other coffee are good too. I want to try other menu next time. It also sell fresh coffee beans that Henry roasted. 

Price and Service - Price is really reasonable. It worths to buy coffee beans too. Service was also nice.
author: Da Won L.

description:
Update: Can I just say I love HoC even more now?! There's three seniors that apparently come here everyday. The two baristas here automatically help them grab the additional chairs they need and bring their coffee and honey to them. Aw :) so sweet! Great customer service from a local coffee house! Love it!

Prep review: I've visited HoC 3 times in a week already, and I'm loving it here. Duh, that's why I keep coming back! 

HoC doesn't have a lot of fancy drinks, but that's also why I love it here. They specialize in the basics and have plenty of options for coffee bean and ground coffee buyers. This is a true coffee house! I've tried their hot latte, chai latte, and cold brew so far and all are good! They have a wider selection of pastries and bagels than Home Cafe up the street (although Home is more popular for their toasts). I love their asiago bagels here, and they slather it up real good with ample cream cheese (although I ask for half their normal amount)! 

Although there aren't a ton of seats here, I've never had trouble grabbing a spot to work, which is one reason why I love it here. That's not to say they don't have business. I've been here for a few hours at a time, and there can be a line of customers but most just take their coffee to go. 

Last thing, if you come here often, grab a stamp card!
author: Angie Y.

description:
Truly local coffee shop still owned by the family who opened it in 1968. They roast their own beans right there in front of you. The aroma is wonderful. 
Delicious pastries, breakfast sandwiches too. Small and cozy spot especially inviting when Karl, the fog, rolls in.
author: W G.

description: Best coffee in town hands down. The only reason why I debate staying at my current place is because of its proximity to HOC! Lol. The love of an orchestra in a cup of Henry's coffee, easily. I go through their stamp cards like water- no shame!! They're consistently great.
author: Mayra S.

description: This place is great! The store welcomes you with the smell of rich coffee right when you walk in.  I ordered an medium iced mocha and it was delicious and had the perfect amount of caffeine to get me going through the day. It wasn't too sweet and had a tasty chocolate-y flavor. The store itself has a nice seating area and some higher chairs by the window. I did some work by the window and there was just a great amount of sunlight going through that made working so much more pleasant. I was able to connect to WiFi easily, (wifi info is under the register) which is great considering its usually pretty difficult for me to get WiFi in cafes. Although there were a few flies flying around, it didn't take much away from the good experience I had here. I also like that this place is a lot less crowded and noisy than Home cafe down the street. This place also offers tea and pastries which was pretty cool! Perhaps I'd try this my next visit. :-)
author: Ivy L.

description:
As far as SF coffee goes, this is right up there with the best. It is a much smaller location if that is what you are looking for with sockets all over for plugging in & charging your technology. I did end up here because Home (~2 blocks towards 19th St) was WAY more packed even in the middle of the day. 

Coffee: nice, simple, elegant, amazing. The cups come in all black (which is new and I appreciate it) and the coffee inside is as good as it gets. Fresh stuff and not overbearing in any way that I can discern.

I can't say much else except for the fact that I would easily come back here in a heart beat (something that's always a huge plus in my books). It's nice and cozy, great coffee and outlets that help me get my work done. The last thing I will say is that I can confirm that the staff is warm and friendly (not to me but observed to others). Definitely give this place a try!
author: Nick W.

description: I m so happy I find this place. I bought their coffee many times in the store and as I was looking for a new coffee place to get my morning coffee I found their coffee shop! Very good coffee. Nice staff. really like their everything bagel.
author: Morea P.

description:
I am surprised I never wrote a review on this establishment. The masterful Henry churned out some great coffee for decades. I, too, was sold on the excellent product. For over 10 years I was a dedicated customer and recommended this coffee house, that had a small town feel, to everyone. 

Then I traveled for fourteen months. I came back to a gentrified business that reminded me of a national chain. Well, at least they would have the same quality of coffee I was anticipating. Right? Nope. It is now subpar. The flavor is flat with a gross aftertaste. The taste similar to those chains. The ones that buy beans in the marketplace on the verge of becoming moldy for pennies on the dollar, then turn around and charge a premium price. Ouch! Ouch! Such a shame.
author: David S.

description: Absolutely love the atmosphere here. Great for studying with plenty of light and the smell of fresh coffee roasting :) I had the earl grey tea and it is honestly the best I've had-- very fragrant but not overpowering. Will definitely come back soon!
author: Jessica W.

description:
Oh! Henry! You did it - you and your son remodeled the Coffee House and it is fantastic!

I am there every 3,000 miles
(and for new battery and new wipers all at Sunset 76 Garage and Gas Station -half a block away) 
- for a supreme Mocha - while I await for my car to be oil changed at the famous Sunset 76 Station...another don't miss and Yelp success story. 
In the early a.m., the joint is packed with a passel of Chinese men...on a coffee break, I guess,  Every single coffee accouterment you need to make superlative coffee is for sale at the shop. No kidding. You will be amazed at the New Henry's!
author: Kae D.

description: We're Henry's customers for a pretty long time, probably for at least 15+ years. That's where we go for all our coffee needs: beans, ground coffee, drinks, coffee advice from Henry and staff, etc. You see, this shop is essential for us, and we truly are happy to have this neighborhood gem around here.
author: Margaret V.

description:
Adorable artisan coffee shop in the Sunset with a handful of house roasted types of beans. Modern setting with a few tables inside.

Gotta love and support long-standing family businesses so I'd be back if I'm in the neighborhood again, despite the fact that my House coffee that day was rather flavorless, and the available selection of pastries was reduced to almost zero at 3pm.
author: Sebastian F.

description: This place has been in this spot for a long long time. They finally got renovated to have a modern look and it looks fantastic, but it's still a neighborhood coffee shop. I realized how much I enjoy the mocha coffees from here because I have had mochas at other coffee places. I think this serves the best mocha for myself. Just the right blend of chocolate and coffee..not too sweet and not bland. Sometimes I like to get a bagel or pastry. Great little shop in the Sunset.
author: Denise C.

description:
I'm sad to have to write this review. I have been coming here for decades. They HAD the best chai in the city. I seriously have tried chai everywhere, no one's could compete. I moved from the sunset to Noe Valley and still came all the over here for my chai.

Well, ever since their remodel, things have been different. New staff making the drinks and the Chai's aren't any good anymore :( 

I've given it time to see if the it was just a case of working out the kinks. I don't know if it's a new recipe or the people making it, but it sucks now. I just came from there 15 minutes ago. I ordered my usual, a large dirty soy chai. Extra hot! I got it barely lukewarm and had to ask the girl to reheat it. They charge $6.50.. premium prices yet I can't tell if there is chai mixture in it or not. It literally tastes like warm soy milk. What happened to all the spice?!?! The extra richness from the added espresso?!?! I just threw it away as warm milk does nothing for me.

What a HUGE disappointment. I'm hoping this review gets their attention and they call someone from the old staff to come in and teach the new staff how to make their epic Chai. Until then, I won't be back :(
author: JoAnna A.

description:
Their coffee is the best!  I've been drinking it since I was a kid, and it's still awesome.  On top of that Henry and his staff are always really nice.

I love the remodel too!
author: Mike L.

description: Attempted to go to a cafe down the street and stumbled upon this place. Enjoyable environment great customer service and not hectic. Was extremely enticed to see some Armenian delicacies on the menu a rare occurrence in the Bay Area.
author: Joseph K.

description: The coffee here is amazing. I went in on the recommendation of a friend who made me a great cup of coffee with beans from Henry's shop,  When I went in, I ordered a latte and also got a sample pack of coffee beans to take home with me (since I wasn't sure which roast I'd prefer). The latte was great, and I'm really excited to try making my own coffee with the beans. Minus one star because I waited a very long time to order (5+ minutes) without being acknowledged at all by the barista. I do like that they sell some coffee equipment and mugs, though.
author: Kristin W.

description: Amazing coffee from a shop that really curates its coffee and knows so much about it. Tucked away in the Sunset far far away from the bougie coffee shops of the Mission and Hayes Valley, but a thousand times better and more authentic.
author: Cassie P.

description: The place look nice. Friendly staff and coffee taste really good. When you go inside, there's a good atmosphere. A great place to study and relax.
author: Kevin Z.

description: Love their coffee and new design.they will make your days.......Great mood with a Great coffee !!!
author: 雪梅

description:
Henry was roasting his beans. I ordered at the counter for half a pound of beans for a friend. The cashier told me to help myself for a cup of coffee while waiting. "Any size." She added. So very Pete's like. I took the medium size cup, the coffee was getting replenished. So I waited until others poured their cups. Henry checks his roaster. Cashier let me smell the canister where she's about to scoop out the beans for me. "Henry's Blend is popular." She scoops out the beans for me and put it in a nice silver bag. It's a medium roast.

There were lots of Chinese people hanging around. I overheard them talking about the holiday plans, in Chinese.

This place was covered on a news segment on 91.7. It's a local joint and has been around for sometime. 

I sent photos to the friend who would be receiving this bag of beans as a gift later this week and said, "Thank you. This was a fun place to visit."

Inside of this coffee house, it was warm and dry, and filled with fresh coffee beans aroma. Henry checks his machine and beans from time to time, turning the knob like the expert that he is. Occasionally he'd look up and check the shop, and see who's coming and going. 

Outside, the wind had picked up, and the rain was coming down hard. It smelled like a wet winter.
author: Victoria E.

description: Good fresh local coffee. Been going here since I was a baby! Love Henry and his delicious coffee
author: Lauren N.

description: What a coffee place! Henry's has it all: it's clean, comfortable, and cool! It's got fast WiFi and great breakfast burritos. Oh and it's affordable!
author: Kevin D.

description:
Friendly staff, great coffee. I always buy a lb of their dark roast when I'm in the area (madre loves their coffee). A pound of coffee bean will cost anywhere between $16-18 packed to your liking.  The place is also newly renovated so its snug and trendy.

Definitely a great neighboring business. I can assure that the products are made with love and nothing but the best.
author: Samantha W.

description: Henry has been hand roasting his coffee for over 50 years, and it is easy to taste.  Where most coffee houses, use a computerized machine to roast their beans, he roasts the finest select beans from around the world in his small "San Franciscan" roaster with an unparalleled technique.  Quality is his passion, which makes this coffee very different from the rest.  Henry thank you for sharing your art and passion with us.  Looking forward to enjoying your fine coffee for years to come!
author: Micaela M.

description: This is hands down the best coffee shop I have been to in the city. The cold brew is amazing, the owners son even came up to us on a Saturday and showed us how they roasted the beans and was a super nice guy! OH MY GOD the breakfast burritos! My boyfriend and I agree these were the best breakfast burritos we have ever had! You will enjoy this place, we're definitely did!
author: Rachel W.

description: The coffee here is exceptionally well!!! The new remodel looks great! It's always nice to see Henry there roasting coffee :)
author: Ashley M.

description: Super cute and clean place. Great coffee and cool setup. Love it. Also, love that the Armenian flag is hanging in the back!
author: Bar B.

description:
While the coffee itself merits a 4, the helpfulness of the baristas and their lack of knowledge is more of a 3. There are many coffee options for buying certain roasts, but I never get good explanations of the taste profiles and I've never been offered to taste a coffee (it's available) to guide my decision. I'm a fan of the Costa Rica one, however. 

My suggestions:
1. Offer a choice of beverage if a full bag (or maybe even half a bag) is purchased. This is a common practice elsewhere. I had to ask firstly whether I would get a stamp on my house of coffee card to go towards a free drink (the answer was no), and then I asked whether they give a cup of coffee to those that purchased bags of coffee. She said I could get a cup if I'd like. I don't like that it wasn't even offered in the first place. Some places even let you choose the type of drink that you'd like. 

2. Offer more types of drip coffee than decaf and coffee of the day (seems to usually be French roast). Other places sometimes offer three roasts for drip. 

I hope some improvements are made so that I can continue buying my beans here.
author: Amadeia R.

description:
They have a different flavor of coffee every day. We came here 4 consecutive mornings, and Henry's coffee did not disappoint. They have shirts, mugs, and coffee makers for sale and they also sell the coffee fresh in bags either whole or ground up.
Highly recommend!
author: Liz J.

description: If you are looking for a coffee house that expresses originality and an amazing vibe than you have found the one. I had an ice cold coffee which really boosted my energy, the greatest part of this coffee house is how it is not crazy packed! I love it
author: Abraham L.

description: A pearl of a little café in the Sunset district, which is otherwise a desert of good coffee. They roast their own coffee, with its own non-Starbucks, non-Peets character. Great service, very friendly. My favorite place for a leisurely weekend breakfast coffee. Great job Henry and team!
author: Karsten W.

description: Got a sandwich and coffee and sad to say the sandwich was not good at all. The coffee may be great but go somewhere else for food.
author: Maryanne M.

description: stopped for breakfast on memorial day. good cappuccino. yummy croissant, and nice location. my friends had bagels and liked them. only thing is that they forgot my friends bagel after they also got put cream cheese inside when she asked for on the side. other than that it was good.
author: Livia R.

description:
House of Coffee is a gem. Henry has owned and operated this business for over 40 years and it's clear he knows exactly what he's doing. We happened to come in while he was roasting some coffee beans and it is quite a sight (and smell)! Now how many coffee shops do you go to that do that?

I haven't tried their drip coffee yet but their Americano is simply a treat . $2.50 gets you a generous 16 ounces of smooth, round espresso made with just the right amount of water so that the drink doesn't feel too thin. My husband got the earl grey latte with soy milk and it was creamy and not watered down in the least, easily the best tea-based latte I've had in years. 

The goodness doesn't stop there--the atmosphere is warm and cozy, the staff is friendly and helpful, and there's a buy 10 get 1 free loyalty card. House of Coffee proves that there is no need to pay an arm and a leg for quality coffee from a small local business. Hands down my favorite coffee shop in all of Sunset!
author: Tiffany H.

description: I've tried a latte and the blue moon loose leaf tea here. The coffee was burnt but the tea was excellent. I've also had the pesto and jalapeño cheese bread... so dang good!
author: Andrew N.

description: Best coffee house in the Sunset. Located off of 19th Ave. Great coffee aroma and clean/fresh tasting coffee.
author: Harlow S.

description:
I live a block away from House of Coffee.. My mom and grandmother have been going for years and its taken me 22 years to try it. I use to make a trip to the nearest Philz (about 15 mins away) almost every morning for some coffee! So I'm extremely glad to have such a great coffee shop near me. 
The coffee at HoC is rich and always wakes me up on those hard early mornings. I order a regular white mocha with an extra shot for $4.75. Kind of pricey but I don't mind it because its just that delicious!
author: Jennifer B.

description: The coffee is great here, however, I also got a croissant and she must've microwaved it rather than use the toaster oven. I walked out with a rubbery croissant, which defeated the purpose of me getting a fresh croissant. It cost me $2.25 for a croissant I took one bite of and threw away.
author: Josh Giosue D.

description: My favorite coffee spot out here. I love the classy black cups--lol. But also my drink is never off, and I can't say that for most places.
author: Darian P.

description: Best small-batch roast in the city. Henry and his son Hrag are skilled roasters. I can't recommend enough!
author: Adam F.

description:
Dropped by this morning at House of Coffee and got greeted with the smell of coffee roasting in the back of the store- LOVE it! In fact, whenever Henry roasts the coffee we can smell it blocks away.

For medium roast lovers, Vista and Bella blends are always consistently good. 
For darker and stronger taste, Henry's French roast are excellent. These robusta beans are big and plum with flavor nicely rounded during the high temp roasting process.
author: Quynh I.

description: Henry's is a great place for a solid cup of coffee!  The newly renovated interior is beautiful and the cleanliness is definitely a plus. Got an Americano and sat down to do some work. It's an intimate space though so it can get kind of loud with the afternoon crowd. But definitely will come back soon to try their other beverages!
author: Alicia T.

description: Awesome smelling hand-roasted coffee beans and absolutely delicious pastries can be found here
author: Rubina M.

description: Coffee is good but their portions are not so great. The ham egg and cheese comes on a croissant and it's mostly a croissant with very little meat or cheese inside. That's called short-changing the customer and gets 1 star at best but coffee is good so they get a break.
author: Hugh M.

description:
Came by for a few pounds of coffee beans the other day and was greeted immediately upon arrival. Staff was quick to put together my order.

They even offered a couple drinks on the house!

My mocha was decent. Espresso was smooth and wasn't too sweet.

They accept credit cards too!
author: Derek S.

description: Such a nice place!!! I always get the jasmine latte with almond milk!!
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
This place is wayyyyyyyyy better than any Starbucks or Pete's I've ever been to! Then again, I have a really high tolerance to caffeine and opt for the strongest coffee I can get my hands on... 

I love this place cause it's so close by and serve pretty decent tasting coffee. I don't understand the hype behind Starbucks when their coffee tastes really watered down and although Pete's SHOULD be stronger, I feel it's sometimes even more watered down depending on the bartista. I don't think I've ever had coffee from here that was too watered down plus you get to put brown sugar or honey in your coffee while you're here.

So apparently the owner roasts the coffee in the early morning hours and imports his beans from all over the world. What's nice is that you get free sesame candy and a free cup of coffee with any purchase of coffee beans even if you only purchased half a pound of beans. That's roughly a $7-$8 bag with all those freebies, mind you. I usually opt for the "Henry's blend" of coffee beans. I'm the worst at making decisions and that seems like the typical coffee most people opt for.

All in all, this place is pretty good for being a mom and pop shop. Again, they're way better than the big franchises and the people working at the counter are super nice and knowledgeable. I'm glad their still in business and hope it stays that way for years to come!
author: Ced C.

description: Love their coffee! It doesn't give me heart burn like the other coffee brands do. I recommend this place. The Armenian dark is really good. The workers are very nice. The owner was so sweet. I love it so much that I made sure to visit them while I was in SF.
author: Anet A.

description:
This place totally sucks! Had to repeat my order over and over, and they still didn't get it right. Staff was too busy chatting to care about making a good drink. Maybe because I'm not Asian? Drink had way too much foam. When I spoke up, they tried to make it my fault. Puke! I hope STARBUCKS takes this place over.

Update: they had a different crew today and the service was much better.
author: Paula I.

description:
how awesome is it when you find a business that prides itself on producing a quality product with fanatical excellence?  House of Coffee owned and operated by master coffee roaster Henry Kalebjian roasts coffee beans on the premises.  how fresh can you get YOUR coffee?
not only can you find wonderful beans, but the coffee drinks made here are tasty and served with a smile.
hidden somewhat in the SF's sleepy sunset district, this spot is truly a hidden treasure.
seek it out because it's worth it. of course there are the usual suspects of French roast beans and the not so common Jamaican Blue Mountain and tea leaves from around the world. 
yes, JYW is a fan!
author: Jeff W.

description: Henry's is a long-time fixture in the neighborhood, but in no sense are they taking their customers for granted. The staff is friendly, helpful and efficient, and the coffee is roasted and prepared by a master. There are one or two other nice places nearby that I have tried, but I always return to Henry's for its lack of pretension and its superior coffee.
author: Matt B.

description: Great coffee. Sometimes I walk down and treat myself with their coffee even though I can make a perfectly good pot in my own home.
author: Christopher M.

description:
It was in the 80s that I first drank Henry's coffee and though I love to explore new roasts elsewhere my rating of Henry's remains "best" even tho his son changed the prices dramatically which caused me to spend more money at Equator Coffee in Mill Valley, a coffee that is really, in my opinion, Henry's only Bay Area rival. 

Vista Allegra is perfection .
author: Percy X.

description: I should start off by saying that my husband is family friends with the owner and his son.  I love my husband and his friends, but I would never endorse a store or product because of this. Fact is, this is hands down the best coffee I have ever have.  I love Bella Finca and Celebes Kalossi Dark - both are great blends - however Henry's Blend is absolutely perfect.  Living an hour and a half away, we frequently order coffee through the mail, and 9 out of 10 times, the beans are here the next day.  Great service and even better coffee.
author: Jayme T.

description: I live in the neighborhood and have been here getting hot chocolate since I was a kid. Has always been consistent and reliable more than a decade later, I have to say my favorite drink is their Kona Mocha. It's better than any frapuccino I've ever had and is well blended and smooth that it doesn't have the separation of drink and ice that other coffee shops may have happen. And no matter who seems to make it, eg. different employees, it always tastes great!
author: Victoria C.

description: Delicious coffee, friendly and a great place to post up and get some work done on a weekday! New remodel looks great!!
author: M V.

description: Plain bagel , not toasted, no cream cheese-$1.90. It is still coffee shop and it is still Noriega st. Ridiculous price. Do they want to compensate for renovation?
author: Sfreviewer K.

description:
Every time I stop by, I'm always happy with the quality of their coffee and their service.  The owner is super nice, and he roasts his own beans!  No wonder why the coffee's so good!  

Although I wish there were more options at the coffee station (soy milk, chocolate/cinnamon powders, etc), the flavor is always spot on even with the basics.  I have yet to experience poor service from the owner or his staff.

Highly recommend!
author: Lutz W.

description:
I was left completely underwhelmed. While the prices are decent and the cafe itself is very unique with various coffee gadgets and beans, my drink itself was completely weak. 

I tried the Soy Cafe Au Lait and all I tasted was the milk. Where was the coffee at!? Yes, it is much better than Starbucks, but there are also much better coffee choices around the area. 

The seating area is also tiny. Definitely a grab&go place.
author: Samantha C.

description:
House of Coffee is a nice little coffee shop on Noriega with less of a hipster vibe and more of an actual coffee shop vibe. I asked for a recommendation and the cashier / barista suggested a latte which works out great since it's my default order anyways. 

Drinks: I ordered a the Latte as recommended and it was very good. HoC offers 3 sizes with different #'s of espresso shots: 2 shots in the small and medium and 4 shots in the large. The prices range between $3-$5 which is reasonable, especially for SF. I opted for the medium since I take my lattes with a "drip back" (I usually try the drip coffee after my real drink). 

Location: Pretty nice location. Close to restaurants and other shops. I drove and parking wasn't an issue on the weekend. I parked on one of the side streets so I didn't need to worry about limiting my stay. 1 Hr parking M-S and no restrictions on Sundays.

Service: Not much to say other than the cashier was really nice. I asked for a recommendation and she provided a fantastic one. Best of all, I didn't have to wait in line very long! I LOVE short lines. 

Other stuff: 
- WiFi worked well for me. I was Yelping and streaming the NBA Summer league simultaneously without skipping a beat. 
- I'm here on a Saturday afternoon and everyone here is north of 40 or with a family. Definitely a more neighborhood feel which is a nice change of pace for the typical SF coffee shop. 
- HoC roasts a pretty wide variety of beans, a few which I am familiar with. I definitely want to see how they roasted the beans in comparison with others I've had in the past. 

There's no WOW factor here but then again.. my standards are exceptionally high right now since I'm in love with Aroma Craft Coffee in SoCal still. Nonetheless, HoC meets all expectations and then some. I'll definitely be back if I'm in the area. Cheers!
author: Chris W.

description: Hands down, the best local coffee shop I have visited in the city and there are plenty! House of Coffee is such an intimate and cozy spot to get your coffee. Each person who works there is knowledgeable and friendly. Their chai lattes are amazing. Be sure to purchase pistachios when they are in season- freshly roasted and each one is split open. Henry is the owner is it is such a pleasure to watch him as he roasts the coffee beans daily.
author: Lisa W.

description:
This quaint little shop is located off the main drag of Noriega, and has been quietly roasting some primo coffee for decades. Henry is the proprietor here and he runs a great little shop. I wanted to get out of the heat and into a cold coffee drink so my girlfriend and I cruised in for something tasty.

The first thing you notice as you walk in is that it's really damn hot. I decided to ordered their mocha frappe which came recommended by the barista. When it arrived, the first sip really hit the spot. The flavor was bold and there was just enough sweetness. I'd order it again, but the green tea looked pretty good too.

They sell loose leaf teas and beans here which was nice to know in case I need a special kind. Service was pretty friendly even though the menu is nowhere near where you order at the front. There's a single table outside where you can sit with your dog, but make sure they don't wander inside. They also don't have WiFi and it's not a good place to get work done, but for coffee it's a-ok.

Food: 7/10

Service: 7/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 7/10
author: Joe M.

description:
I ordered thru their website the Vic's blend. 
Wow it's the best coffee I have ever had. 
I'm hooked for life. 
I live in Oxnard and frankly there are many choices for coffee beans. 
Family owned, it's obvious they take pride in roasting their beans. 
So flavorful, don't hesitate I highly recommend.
author: Viken C.

description:
HoC is the homie coffee shop in the Sunset District. 

I used to wake up in the morning as a kid and I would smell the beans being roasted from a few blocks away. HoC roasts their own beans and makes their own blends too. Best Saturday morning wake up call ever!

$1.75 can get you a fragrantly delicious blend of coffee, brown sugar and milk or $3 for a mocha with extra espresso. Scoot over Starbucks, I'd rather come to HoC for the mom n pop experience than your second rate out of state shit. 

The female baristas are cute and friendly too.
author: Jason C. J.

description:
Simply put, the best coffee shop in town... and that's saying a lot, considering! They (Henry) has been around roasting and serving coffee way before most people knew what a "Barista" is.  Henry's collected more varieties of beans from pretty much every corner of the world.  This is a serious coffee joint.  If you are looking for trendy place where they're spinning old vinyl records while someone reads you poetry (ok, I made up that last part :)) and then charge you some obscene amount for a pound of beans or an espresso/cup of coffee, you're better off at a SOMA/Mission joint.  But if you want the real deal, a coffee shop that (now that Henry's son has joined him) will always be around no matter what the fad/trend of the day is, then House of Coffee (or "Henry's" as most of us affectionately call it) is the place to be. Enjoy!   

(Also... I'm not much of a tea guy but have been told the selection of teas is also pretty awesome and some rare types too.)
author: Raffi M.

description:
This is a great place to grab a quick coffee or excellent beans. Mellow, comfortable atmosphere most of the time, fits the area. Food misses the target for me. Service hit-and-miss.

Been getting morning coffee 2-3 times weekly here for years and I've tried most everything they offer. So much potential with the HOC... Henry is always there, roasting beans or working on a computer. He's sort of a legend in the Sunset. I have only seen him interact with a customer once, though - maybe he's the quiet type. Adds to his legendary mystique! Great beans and incredible selection of a variety of roasts and flavors. 5 stars for that portion of the business. However, the rating takes a big hit from the "coffee shop" part.  

PLUS: Self-serve coffee is always different and tasty. Bean selection is second to none. Excellent advice and knowledge of taste and body. Rarely a long wait to grab drip coffee. Parking is usually easy.

MINUS: Coffee shop eats are so easy and could be so good here, but they're not. Stale pastries wrapped in cheap cellophane, microwaved breakfast sandwiches (which can be delicious if done properly) that are sometimes bad and sometimes worse (inconsistent.) The staff is hit and miss; high turnover in the last few years. I have never been able to pick out a manager or supervisor behind the counter. Seemingly loose working environment. Not much effort going on most days. The cream/sugar area often smells of rotten milk and is usually wiped but rarely cleaned. I noticed old dried splashes of coffee in the lid-area during my last visit that made me want to go without.

The HOC is a staple of this area and seems to be improving of late so I'm eager to see if a great coffee shop can emerge at this historic coffee roaster.
author: Patrick H.

description:
They roast their own coffee right there in the shop, next to the register so you can smell the aroma from the curb.  Well, the aroma always includes a little burnt beans so if that's not your thing, you may not want to sit at this cafe.  Their espresso and drip coffees are flavorful and robust.

Small soy latté was $3.75.  They have punch cards where you can get the 10th or 11th cup free (I forget which).  Also, I hear that on X-mas Eve or X-mas Day (again, I forget which, probably Eve) they give free drinks to their patrons.  Now that's a nice neighborhood coffee shop.

They only have one green zone parking space out front so parking could be a hit or miss.
author: Alice L.

description: Best coffee in town.  They actually roast beans right by where you pick up your coffee!  So awesome.  Just don't expect a seat in the morning time.  I go twice a week, and the outside seats are taken up by the local ajeossis and there is an...urban camper...that takes the prime real estate in the front
author: Choladeva C.

description:
Taste - 4 stars
Service - 4 stars
Value - 4 stars

Great local coffee joint.  Workers are nice here and coffee is delicious.  They roast their own beans in a cool roaster that looks like an old school locomotive.

Support your local businesses that do a good job.
author: Sunny W.

description:
Love love love Henry's House of Coffee! Just by walking in, you can smell the roasted beans. Just pure amazingness! White Chocolate Mocha is quite delicious. 

Great coffee! Don't expect a place to sit, but it is an awesome cup of coffee to go. The owner is awesome too!
author: Raquel M.

description:
It's 7 am and you're standing on the corner of 23rd and Noriega. Go ahead and take a sniff. The aroma of House of Coffee will take you by your nosey and gently pull you into their amazing coffee shop. 

The store is owned by a nice man named Henry and his coffee is the real deal. I kid you not when I say that House of Coffee's aroma stretches out for around a block or so. Advent coffee drinkers flock to this shop in the morning, and during the afternoon, you can still spot a few wanderlusters enjoying their roast in the outside seating area.

For me, Henry's Coffee may be a little too strong, but I do occasionally treat myself to a sweeter White Chocolate Mocha. If you're a coffee person and you live in the Sunset, House of Coffee is worth waking up a bit extra early to do your coffee run. 

Hey, you can even impress your boss with a coffee here!
author: Ringo M.

description: Service is passable although Starbucks is significantly better. Coffee is comparable to Starbucks as well. I.e cappuccino.  The taste was not rich but bitter, and had no balance whatsoever like from other artisan coffee shops in the Bay Area.  Pass
author: Logan B.

description:
I sat with my laptop but the wifi is crap. Unable connected. If you wanna work there. I want't suggest that place. The coffee is OK. Location is good. The environment is good. 

But some of staff need to training. I heard calling for coffee, and still waiting my bagel and I didn't hear any call of it. I sat and wait for 10 mins. When I got it, bagel was getting cold. 

If costumes didn't hear the first call could you please make the second call? Save your time save our time!
author: Ting J.

description: Was getting a cup of mocha cause you know, it's Monday and Amir hates Monday's. I decided to get the mocha(4.00+tax) and add Carmel and salt to the top. Overall pretty good brew and amazing flavors. Will come again!
author: Amir M.

description: Tried this for the first time last week and again this week. Great location next to some shops on Noriega and near Muni stops. Coffee was fresh and I enjoyed some cookies there too.
author: Larry K.

description:
House of Coffee"s forte is roasting coffee.  a sideline is selling  imported jams, cookies, and cookies. eats include muffins, crossaints, bagels, pastries, and cereals.

seating is limited. to a few tables inside and out.
pour: ethiopian ... (m. 2)
-very smooth, rich, mellow, slightly acidic
5 stars.

drips:
-good value, would cost $3+ elsewhreres
author: Victor G.

description:
I don't think I've ever been to a coffee shop that roasts their own coffee beans. Talk about quality. When I passed by the shop, I couldn't help but smell a particularly fragrant smell of freshly made coffee that I simply couldn't pass up on.

The shop is owned by a father and son who are so personable and friendly. You can really tell that these two love their coffee, and they like it done right. I personally have my own French press and grinder at home to steep my Kona blends, but their collection of coffee beans here is amazing! I definitely need to come back here for some beans when my stash runs out.

I like my coffee black and as a dark roast, but I really don't care for the Pikes Place Roast from Starbucks. Just because it's a dark roast doesn't mean it should be bitter. 

I bought a medium coffee, which was so reasonably priced. I should have bought a large, it was so delicious. Next time I'll probably get an americano for the sake of having their coffee hot off the press, even though the drip coffee was outstanding.
author: Cara O.

description:
I love this coffee place! Its right down the street from my house and the coffee is great. However, most of the girls working have the worst attitude I have yet to encounter at a cafe. There is one girl in particular-- asian, brown hair, tattoos, and usually wears a giants tee. I have never had a pleasant experience with her. She NEVER smiles, hardly says hello, and today she threw my onion bagel across the counter while barking the order. I actually dread going into House of Coffee when she's working but its the most convenient for me. I understand some people have bad days but she seems to hate her life every single day and this usually means its time to quit and find some other job. 

Ill still support Henry and his delicious coffee but its time for this rude girl to go.
author: Jaycee S.

description: Small coffee house that makes an amazing cappuccino! I was pleasantly surprised, as I was initially looking for the closest Blue Bottle. Glad I stumbled in to this one.. I would highly recommend!
author: Gen C.

description:
The quickest I've ever drank a cup of coffee. It was that good. I had a medium of their blend of the day, which was the "Bold Blend".

At first I thought this place was just another coffee shop, worthy of three stars average, maybe even two stars since I didn't think I'd go out of the way and return. It's located in the Outer Sunset! The inside of the shop is small; three tables for two not conducive for group meetings; closes at 6pm daily, 3pm on Sundays.

However, that "Bold Blend" convinced me to return, and so did the outdoor seating. This place is also quieter than other cafes. The staff is friendly and parking was easy to find.
author: Peter L.

description: I definitely have a soft spot for this place. You're not going to get incredible ambiance, but you will get a wide array of coffee and tea options for very cheap prices. It's not Philz, but everything is made quickly, and you can't really find another walk-able cafe in the area. They have a little culvert for outdoor seating, but don't expect to stay for too long because this place can get crowded. Free wi-fi though?
author: Danny C.

description:
The coffee here is roasted on site and I think it's great. If you purchase a pound of coffee they give you a free cup to go. On holidays they brew VERY EXPENSIVE blends and put it in their daily pump and sell it for two bucks.  Very kid friendly. Free cookies sometimes and free sesame candies for the kids. 
I had a bagel with bacon and egg the other day and it was a real egg instead of what most coffee houses now use....usually a pre scrambled patty.  You can actually see the yolk like you cooked it at home. 
Henry the owner is a very nice man.
author: Johnny B.

description:
Don't believe the angry people and their reviews. Click on their history. Some people live to be angry. 

As for HoC, awesome as always. And it gets better all the time because I am now starting to know the regulars as well as the staff.

An awesome neighborhood coffee shop.
author: Miguel C.

description: The place is decent and not crowded. I come here all the time for coffee. My favorite drink is the earl grey tea latte with soy milk. It's really quite wonderful. My only complaint is that it's not consistent depending who is making it. I will not order it from one particular barista. Other than that, this place is great.
author: Aleck L.

description:
Henry the owner, freshly roasts his beans if you come in between 10a- noon everyday (besides Sundays) 

I love their tuxedo hot chocolate drinks and their jasmine soy tea lattes. 

The turnover time to get a table is relatively short and the radio music isn't too loud and annoying like other cafes. 

The baristas are so friendly and full of personality. Love spending afternoon days here :)
author: Vicky L.

description:
This is still one of the best cups of coffee but after living in this coffee oasis for a few years there are many, many other coffee shops that are a little better. Don't get me wrong, it is still amazing. 

This is one of the best cups of black coffee in San Francisco. 

98% chance I will return.
author: Justin S.

description:
I knew Henry when I lived on 17th Ave and Vicente back in 1980.  He was a gentle and kind man.   When i first met him, we sat down and chatted about the characteristics I like in coffees and suggest a mixed blend.  Somehow, Henry got it right and that was my regular blend for 7 years.
Alas, I moved to Foster City and it became difficult to visit Henry's shop.  I am so pleased that he is still in business at the same location on Noriega.

Best to you and your family, Henry!!
author: Wallace Y.

description: small and very efficiently run coffee shop..coffee taste good and the owner is expert coffee maker.
author: Prabin S.

description:
Absolutely charming little neighborhood coffee store. This place is so charming that it almost seems out of place amidst all the morning dim sum bakeries and Chinese supermarkets that populate this general area. Or maybe that adds to the charm of the establishment, who knows.

Their coffee is mighty strong. Like John Henry strong. I ordered the kona mocha, with which I was initially disappointed with because I had not realized that it was a frappe type drink. But even for a silly-looking iced drink that comes in a translucent portable cup, it's ridiculously strong. It was so strong that I had forgotten what I had that morning until the next day when I looked in my fridge and found a doggy bag of dim sum on the top shelf left over from the day I went.

Now that I've gribbled on enough, the establishment is very cozy and quaint; it's almost as if they have one of those old school steamers in the back somewhere and that's where they bring out all the coffee from. Think of the place as a smaller, family-owned Peet's Coffee, but with better customer service and stronger coffee.

I can't believe I used the word "strong" six times in this review.
author: Scott S.

description:
I was in dire need of caffeine when my sister mentioned she had spotted a coffee shop down the road. Was totally grumbling about the lack of Starbucks on Noriega St when I walked in and immediately ate my words.

The space was cozy and warm, but the real catch was the overpowering fragrance of coffee being hand-roasted on-site.

Judging by the smell, House of Coffee is legit. I was also charmed to discover that this is a family-run coffee shop that has been in business for 45+ years.

Cute, affordable and delicious -- what more can you ask for?
author: Tiffany W.

description:
I stopped by here after seriously needing some coffee and food while bringing my flat tire to the gas station next door. What a pleasant surprise! This place doesn't look like much, but it's some of the best coffee in SF for sure. Apparently other people agree because the owner was filming an interview about his coffee roaster as I sat and waited for my car to be fixed.

I had an iced latte and a breakfast sandwich for $10. The sandwich had sausage, bacon, and real eggs and cheese on ciabatta and was seriously tasty. My latte was strong without being bitter and was exactly what I needed.
author: Amanda B.

description: It looks like a nice little cafe. I thought this would be another place for coffee and breakfast. Unfortunately, the main thing they are selling is coffee. Pastries look old to me. So I just got a small coffee and went to a chinese bakery instead. Then, had my breakfast by the beach.
author: The Black Cat C.

description:
You can smell the coffee aroma in here with every inhale you make. YUM. I caught the owner roasting his coffee beans during one visit and WOW... he sure is passionate about it. That's what we all want for a nice cup of coffee during our day. Lattes are great! Regular black coffee is dark and you can definitely taste the flavor. This place is not about watered-down coffee. Not at all.

One thing is I wish they used more cream cheese on their bagels with no extra charge. They only use 1 to-go container of cream cheese for 1 bagel. Some places load the cream cheese on the bagel as if they were using 2-3 containers! That's just my preference.

Definitely the go-to coffee spot on Noriega St. though!!
author: Nancy N.

description:
Recently tried this place and it has stolen my coffee-lovin' heart. I had starbucks the next day and almost threw it away. 

I've only tried their mocha variations, but each drink was HEAVENLY. Can't wait to try more!

Open early, friendly baristas, awesome coffee - what better way to start your day?
author: Kriz K.

description: I love this neighborhood coffee house, it's been there forever!  Service is always warm and friendly and coffee is nice and strong.  I bought the Gypsy Mix for the office and everyone loves it because it has an amazing aroma, very fresh and strong.  I'll be going there again tonight to get more!
author: winnie l.

description: Easily the best coffee shop in the Sunset and one of the best in SF. This is the real deal and if you're lucky, you'll smell the evidence of that for blocks every morning upon going to this gem. All their coffee is amazingly perfect. My wife is obsessed with their Dirty Chai's (Chai Latte with Espresso) and I will testify, definitely the best one I've had ever. Make sure to support this family owned, legendary, spot! The owner and head roaster, Henry is very nice and will answer any questions about roasting that you might have. Great guy! Enjoy!
author: David S.

description: My boyfriend introduced me to House of Coffee a year ago! On this last trip there I got to meet Henry! What a treat! He's so sweet and recommend a Thailand coffee. I took home to bags of beans this time and I just brewed some of the fresh ground Thailand coffee and it's amazing!! Honestly, one of the best cups of coffee I've made at home.
author: Midori H.

description:
The coffee is great! There is also a good selection of coffee accessories so you can get you beans to go and enjoy a perfect cup of coffee at home.
But what's wrong with the girls working there (afternoon shift)? They give you that kind of attitude that can completely spoil your day, making you feel so humiliated as if you are even not supposed to get your coffee with them. No smile, no greeting, no have a good day when you are leaving. Extremely rude and unfriendly. Please notice that the male baristas and owners are genuinely nice.
This coffee shop is just around the corner from my house, but I had to stop coming there because of the cashiers' attitude. And it's not just one bad day which all of us have some time. It's like all the time. So sad...
author: Katie K.

description: Update: Got a response from the owner saying that they now have simple syrup by the espresso machine. Hooray! Five stars for being responsive to customers.
author: Dee R.

description: You can taste the love in every sip... There are a lot of coffee options, now that coffee is a big bu$iness in TheCity. But for anyone that wants the real deal, this is it.
author: derk p.

description: This place serves very strong coffee!  They offer almond milk too!  There's plenty of supplies for the folks who brew at home.  Those are the good points.  The bad points are the staff is very young and inexperienced, the seating is very limited and occupied by a large contingent of men that are taking up all the space with no apparent plans to leave.  I'm waiting on my car being serviced next door.  I've been here 45 minutes and they were here when I got here, and they're still here!  It has to be hard on a small business starting out to walk that line of making space available and welcoming but what can they do if their regulars but one cup of coffee and then don't leave for three hours!
author: Donna O.

description: I like coffee.  I know good coffee from bad coffee.  This is great coffee!  They roast their beans on the premises - always smells wonderful.  This is definitely not a cafe where you can sit around all day - very limited space.  It's also not a place where you get chummy with the employees nor where they get chummy with you.  They work.  So, I wouldn't characterize it has a happy-fun place.  The owner is always present and takes pride in the product he serves.  I like that.
author: Adam S.

description: Sometimes, all you're looking for is a good cup of coffee, and you want it right now!  On a late Sunday afternoon, we struck out at a couple of coffee shops, and pointed the car towards home - only to come across House of Coffee, which was busy with contented folks inside and at the outdoor tables.  Looked like a good place to stop, and we're glad we did!  A simple drip coffee was hot, quickly served, and tasted just fine.  Not every coffee shop needs a wall full of pastries!  "House of Coffee" was just as advertised - a house of coffee!
author: Cheryl N.

description: Pretty cool coffee shop in the Sunset. Got a Kona Mocha and it was pretty much blended Kona coffee drink. It was tasty and you could taste the coffee. I like when they highlight the coffee instead of masking the flavor with sweeteners and sugar. I would have rather enjoyed more seating room inside since it was such a cold day. They have more merchandise to buy, like a french press and all the coffee making gadgets you would ever need instead of seats for customers. It's more of a grab and go spot instead of grab a cup and stay around and enjoy yourself. Good coffee, would have enjoyed a more welcoming atmosphere that made it seem like you could stay a while which is what we ended up doing but outside in the cold on a very small table.
author: Jeromy G.

description:
So glad this little gem is still open.

love my neighborhood and the coffee.
author: Carol Y.

description: My favorite neighborhood coffee shop. Great service with a cute and clean atmosphere. Friendly baristas and best lattes ever! Also jasmine tea latte and chai lattes are yumm too.
author: Nicole K.

description: Have been coming here for some time now. Employees are always happy to greet you! Really good coffee.
author: Igor B.

description: Very classy coffee shop with excellent customer service. Try the Bella Finca roast! So delicious!
author: Sherry S.

description: Stopped by for some coffee and wifi. Small coffee shop with limited seating, large array of loose leaf teas, and an amazing selection of house roasted coffee. If you don't know what you want then I suggest asking them.
author: Michael S.

description:
I am picky about the coffee beans I buy. I want them to be fresh, and I prefer medium roasts to "French" or "City" roasts. At the same time I need the acidity to be well-controlled, which tends to be more pronounced in lighter roasts. It's tough to find all that. I've given up on Starbuck's, Peete's, and the local supermarkets. But I struck gold at Henry's House of Coffee.

Living on the peninsula, I had done an online search for roasters in the area and Henry's House of Coffee came up. They seemed to have a lot of different roasts available, so I resolved to give them a try. Once there, I explained my preferences to the baristas at the counter, and they recommended the "Vista Alegre" beans. Visually they looked good: Modest size beans, medium brown and without all the surface oil of the darker roasts. Promising! I bought the beans and got a free coffee and some candy along with them. Nice touch!

At home I pulled an espresso shot from those beans. It was fantastic. Just what I hoped for. Full of chocolate and caramel flavor, sweet, full-bodied, and without being overly acidic. Vista Alegre is my new favorite coffee, though I look forward to trying some of Henry's other medium roasts over the coming weeks.
author: Matthias S.

description: This morning started out stressful when I got a flat tire on the way to the airport. Luckily though, this place is within a block of the service station. Thanks to super friendly service, flavorful coffee, and a tasty bagel, I'm able to await word on my car and maintain a good mood; something I thought impossible just an hour ago.
author: Deidre E.

description: This place makes the best Americano! I've lived in the neighborhood my whole life and have tried almost everything around and nobody comes close.   I deducted 1 star only for breakfast sandwiches.  Not very good.
author: Don C.

description: I live close by to this place but never been here. So I finally decided to try this place out. The employees were not so friendly. Not even a little smile. It was like they did not want to work there. I got a small latte? It was okay but I've had better. They have stamp cards for drinks.
author: Carmen L.

description: Henry is the man-- his blend is superb. Turns non coffee drinkers into converts! I love the shop and how it reaks of quality - roasted coffee infront of your eyes, quality European imports everywhere... I'm so happy I found this place... No joke I cannot get coffee anywhere else after this, kinda annoying actually cuz I'm driving 20min across city because I know it's worth it- don't even try to buy a lb of grocery store or peets coffee after trying this
author: John O.

description:
Still love coming by here from time to time especially after lunch at the restaurants a few blocks up the street. Excellent coffee that you pour yourself!

Also, contrary to what the Yelp listing currently shows, they do have free wifi. Comes in handy during occasion when, even though I use an iPhone, a wifi helps compared to using the 4G or the LTE network (like for having the Candy Crush application log onto Facebook, something that's more and more impossible with the phone network). :)
author: H K.

description:
There really isnt anything like Dunkin Donuts, but this comes pretty close. Good coffee, great service, and surprisingly great price. 

bonus: there is a group of old men talking outside at pretty much any given time for that cute hometown feel.
author: Jamie P.

description: I don't know what's so hot about this place. Yeah, they have a cool looking machines and nice workers, but eh. It's all about the coffee right?
author: Jess W.

description:
One of the best coffee joints in SF. Henry and his baristas are incredibly friendly and helpful. We came in for a little coffee break with our clinical group... Our instructor is a patron and long time customer of Henry's. 
I ordered a cup of Henry's blend:  bold aroma, fragrance is robust, great roasted smell, the body is smooth not heavy on the tongue , taste is almost buttery and satisfying, fully-developed body; not harsh, and the acidity is slight, but does not overpower the overall cup of Joe.
Good toasted bagels and breakfast sandwiches as well. Place gets packed and sometimes hard to finds seats... but it's so chill and staff doesn't mind if you stay long. =D One of the reasons why I love SF =D coffee spot hidden gems in the sunset!
author: Aga O.

description: IMO, the best coffee roaster & beans in San Francisco. Roasted on the premises by a master. It's very fresh, great nose; I buy enough whole beans for 2 weeks at a time. I like his roasts: not too dark, not too light, just right. They also make the best espresso I've had at a retail place in San Francisco. No attitude from the staff. Reasonable prices.
author: Deb L.

description: Not bad but not great. If you are thinking Peets/Starbucks, this place is competitive. Blue Bottle, Ritual, or 4Barrels, keep walking - you will be disappointed.
author: Z K.

description:
The best place to buy coffee in the city. My whole life (I'm 48), I never liked the taste of coffee.  Until I had a cup of coffee at Henry's on Noriega. He roasts his own beans. Every other cup of coffee I tasted was bitter and burnt. 
Coffee lovers you don't have to drink horrible coffee. Go to Henry's.
author: Leanne F.

description:
Updated Review by Yours Truly, The House of Coffee devotee. Why? Because it's a Shrine to many of the worlds finest coffees, a San Francisco original roaster (and yes, Henry still roasts beans himself using decades of skill, intuition and appreciation for the art. You can stand and watch, ask questions, learn some local history, smell the beans). Jamaican Blue Mountain Reserve! Kona King! Galapagos! Yemen, Bella, two kinds of Costa Rican, come on! Cruise the world of coffee right here. (and he ships)

I know (and adore) the owner, Henry, I know the staff, their skills, dedication and professionalism in serving San Francisco's wonderfully diverse customer base with a guaranteed quality, satisfying product and a smile every day. The House of Coffee isn't "Corporate Coffee", momentarily fashionable or littered with glam, hipsters, attitudes, laptops and a rude silence. Real people come here, for generations, because it's just that good all of the time. I have had a hundred cappuccino's at House of Coffee, (and actually drank them) without encountering a single problem on either side of the counter but if there ever was, the staff would gladly fix it. 

That being said, I take great offense at someone posting a "review" like the one below because it isn't true, honest, fair or unbiased - all of the characteristics that responsible (and sane) Yelp users are supposed to consider before barfing a slanderous, crazed rant. I am very familiar with both the owner, Henry, and most of his experienced staff, all of whom are dedicated to providing a quality product in a friendly, courteous manner to every customer. Every barrista that has made me a cappuccino at Henry's House of Coffee (I only drink the very best cappuccino, and have even had a few in Berkeley) has done so with the requisite experience and craftsmanship, and always exactly as ordered. The employees are local people, genuine, knowledgeable and friendly. None of these hard-working folks deserve the cheap and slanderous insults handed out wholesale by someone "just passing through", apparently bent on also passing judgement. That's not what I believe Yelp strives to accept as helpful or even reflective of a genuine shared experience.
author: Markee S.

description:
HoC is a small and honest coffee roaster/shop. They seem very simple but in actuality they are quite detailed. 

Its nice that they do sell batches of Blue Mountain beans.

They also make a nice latte which I am able to enjoy with their outdoor seating.
author: phillip w.

description:
"Its not coffee dude ... its THE CONQUISTADOR!!"

Hands down best coffee roaster/vendor in the sunset. My favorite: Costa Rica Conquistador FTW every time.  So if you're into strong, non acidic flavor profile give it a try, if not just talk to Henry about what you're looking for in your coffee, chances are he will give you some interesting suggestions (how i discovered the Conquistador).
author: Oleg H.

description:
Went here for the 5th time to show my friends my "coffee spot". The coffee , as alway, was great but we noticed an unpleasant young female at the counter with attitude that helped us. The other times I've gone here, i'd dismissed her attitude for having a "bad day" but today, it seemed as though she was literally "hating her job" with her eyes rolling and constant sighing. Part of the experience of having  a great "go to" coffee spot is the customer service and she was certainly lacking it. 
I dont want to put her on the spot but I do encourage management to talk to her . Customer service is important.  I understand there are times when we are "under the weather" but the first thing people see when they come into a business is the person in the front who is representing the company. Is this how you want customers to perceive your business?
My friends did like the coffee but not the service received. 

Sorry, it just left a bad taste in my mouth.
author: Annette F.

description:
Great coffee, I love that they roast their own here. It always smells amazing walking by. The owner (the older gentleman with glasses) is very sweet.

The only reason I'm not giving four stars is because I came here once for a cafe au lait. The workers had never heard of it, and proceeded to laugh in my face as if I were a crazy person asking for something weird. Okay, sorry that you guys didn't even know how to make a simple, traditional coffee drink. I would've explained to them what it was made with, but the whole thing left such a bad taste in my mouth that I just grabbed a regular coffee and left as quickly as I could.
author: Trang N.

description:
I went with a one-pound bag of Costa Rican whole bean today.
I also sat in with a large cup of House brew - Conquistador today.
The Conquistador was fresh and medium-strength and no acidity.
There is limited seating inside and a couple of tables outside for the smokers.
Quite a bit of regulars at this place in the 30 minutes that I sat inside.

I brewed a single cup at first of the Costa Rican beans.

Verdict? 
- Very smooth, 
- light/medium strength,
- very fragant, and 
- zero acidity.

Real nice find.
I plan to go back again.
Azn barista chick is very cool too!
author: Derek N.

description: Great customer service from Henry's House of Coffee. I recently received shipment of beans from Henry's online service and love the Kenyan. Can't wait to try the others.  Thank you Henry.
author: Michael R.

description: The coffee is pretty good. They roast it here. Og? Ft? Unclear. I doubt it. Still a legit place to get a cup. They've got some toxic drinks like 'Moka blended latte' and have egg bagels, cereal and juice. Glad the place is here but wouldn't travel far for it.
author: Catherine C.

description: While visiting San Francisco I discovered this coffee shop not to far from my Airbnb.  It was a little before 7am and the shop was still closed.   But the staff was punctual and opened right 7.  I was help by a young woman, Asian with glasses about 20 to 30 years of age.  At first she was pleasant and took my order.  A young man took over the register and he was extremely pleasant.  The young lady made my coffee and handed it to me.  So far so good.   I had paid for a croissant and I mentioned that to her. She gave me a hard look and asked the other guy if I had paid for a croissant.  He said yes and she grabbed a croissant, put it into a pastry bag and tossed it in front of me.   I asked her if she could heat it up.  She snatched it  from my hand and threw into the microwave.  After she grabbed it and again threw it onto the counter in front of me. She then stormed off.  WTF!?!!!  Jeckle and Hyde personality!!!  My son was shock.  I didn't say anything to her and walked out.  I'll never go back there again because of her rudeness.  Oh yeah, the croissant was stale but coffee was good .
author: Louis B.

description: The BEST Chai latte is the City...period!
author: Allen H.

description: Friendly local coffee shop. Good coffee, roasted in-house. I just wish they wouldn't wrap their bagels and pastries in saran wrap. Has no-one else told them?
author: Ritch G.

description:
This little coffee shop is a pleasant place to visit.  The staff are extremely polite and go out of their way to help you choose what to drink.  I requested a green tea latte...I never knew you have any kind of green tea to go in the drink.  The girl behind the counter actually let me smell the tea leaves to make my choice.

The downside of this place is that there is not enough seating.
author: Cherrymae J.

description: I have known Henry for over twenty years.  His passion is coffee, he lives and breaths it.  The quality if fantastic fresh , fresh, fresh .  The bean Bella Finca is my personal favorite.
author: Ronald M.

description:
Only place I can drink coffee, beats Starbucks for sure.

I always get the brew of the day with soy milk and brown sugar.. so good. I also saw the owner on the first day I went in, roasting the beans which is such a awesome first impression! And good thing I live close, could just walk and get some good local coffee!!
author: Hung B.

description: I have passed by this small coffee shop a dozen times without trying it out until today. It's a small, local coffee shop, which still roasts their own beans. It seems to be one of those small businesses that depends on the neighborhood to keep it afloat. They keep it simple so don't expect any latte art on your espresso. But, at least the coffee is strong and beats Starbucks any day of the week.
author: Bailey Z.

description: An excellent espresso, but the prices? ooftah! Still if you are going to pay $3.50 for a medium Americano it had better be good and Henry's doesn't disappoint.  Service has always been helpful and friendly too.
author: Julienne G.

description:
I was at your coffee shop yesterday afternoon(10/9), and your undertrained staff treated me like shit. I went your venue because of good reputation for coffee, and I am a huge fan for good local small roasted coffee; but this is what I got: 

Your "just-out-of-high-school" barista who didn't even know how to use the expresso machine made me some caffein mixture under another young man's supervision.
