You know... travel cups, demitasse cups, french presses, all those "knick knacks" coffee lovers/afficionados love so much.  I'm not usually a chai drinker, but they have the best damn chai I've ever had too.  Mama always gets that here, even if she's in a coffee mood.
author: Barry A.

description: We received a bag of whole bean coffee (Bella) from Henry's House of Coffee as a gift from a friend.  What a nice gift that was!  We're pretty picky about coffee, so we were hoping it was going to be good...  And, sure enough, it didn't disappoint!  It was excellent!  ...Bold and smooth at the same time!   Can't wait to try some of the other roasts and blends!  It looks to us that Henry's got a knack for this!
author: Caroline S.

description: House of Coffee has the best coffee ever! My favorite is their French Roast, and I believe he roasts it everyday! None of this nasty starbucks coffee!  Henry the owner and roaster has been doing this for over 30 years (at least) so he knows his coffee!  If you call ahead of time he can have your order ready for you if you are in a super rush, and if you ask really nice he will throw in some yummy sesame candies for you!!
author: Cassie L.

description: I bought a pound of freshly roasted Galapagos organic (roasted in the store that morning). Took it home and made a pot in a french press. The coffee was so sweet it tasted like hot chocolate! No wonder coffee is considered a "sweet drink."
author: Scott R.

description:
Unbelievable coffee!  There is no place better...  Once you have tasted House of Coffee's quality, you will never go back to Starbuck's or Peet's.  I do owe it to those other places for raising the bar but it would be like comparing hand-made Belgian chocolate to Hershey's.  

A true coffee lover must try this place.  Vista Allegre beans are my all-time favorite.  Smooth, intense and beans here are roasted daily in small batches (which coffee afficionados know means optimum flavor).  Service is wonderful, expertise is unparalleled.  The owner is a 4th generation roaster whose family even trained Peet at one time!
author: Serena L.

description: Love the coffee here.  Best in the city, particularly mixed in with that Sunset fog.  Could use a few more tables and maybe Wifi and it could be a home away from home.
author: Adam O.

description: Their coffee is good, and I love those "coffee cards" where you buy like 11 or 12 cups of coffee and get one for free!
author: Vivian C.

description:
M-O-M-M-Y needs C-O-F-F-E-E! 
(sing along, everyone)

House of Coffee is a real gem in the Sunset. They have great drip coffee, and we buy a pound of beans here every week for our home brew. Henry is great! Some of the baristas are a little slow, and have scalded milk on a few of our espresso drink orders. 

They also have drink cards, where you buy 12 and get one free! The only things better than coffee is free coffee :)
author: bree g.

description:
loved their coffee. and the whole store just smell so good. definitely recommended for anyone who likes coffee. 

and about starbucks, 
come on people, 
support our local business please!
author: Choco M.

description: Best place in my neighborhood to get coffee.   The coffee used to be much stronger though i know they switch up the drip flavors but recently i've been getting cups that are pretty watered down.   maybe im coming in at the wrong times.  Nice place to get beans if you like to roast at home.
author: david w.

description: Henry is fantastic, always friendly and quick to get you anything you might need. Oh, and the coffee is great!
author: Julie M.

description: Lattes are good. Service is fast. What else do you need in a coffee shop?
author: Scott B.

description: house of coffee. mmm yes. the coffee it wonderful. i'm a latte fan so i have to say this a great place if you're looking for lattes. one of my favorite places in the sunset. there's always people behind the counter, you don't have to wait long for your drink. though, the place is a bit small, i'd like to sit down and enjoy my coffee, but that option isn't always there.
author: Natalie B.

description: good, friendly service... but my latte was a little too much on the bitter side for me. however, i love coffee, and this shop is seriously too cute. aside from the smokers outside. so... i'd give it another shot
author: Aletheia W.

description: this is a place where i stop by everytime after my facial. it's the fragrant coffee smell that leads me to the place. how often you could smell the coffee from few stores away?
author: cynthia l.

description: This is the one coffee shop I don't tell anyone about.  This place has been around since I was little and I'm so glad it 's still here.  It was my best-kept secret until now.  The coffee is amazing because the owner roasts his own beans right there.  Local, small businesses like this just aren't around anymore so please stop by to try this amazing coffee.  My caveat is that this coffee isn't for the pseudo coffee drinkers who like super sweet coffee.  It's for the true coffee lovers.  And please don't whine about the wait.  It's one owner and his barista.  It's not an assembly line of workers giving you syrupy sweet mochas per protocol.  These are true coffee drinks made with care.
author: Dorothy W.

description: Best local coffee shop in the city! Henry runs the place and if you are there when he's standing by the roaster, creating lovely new beans to brew with, you're in for a treat. Actually, you are in for a treat regardless as the coffee there is always great, the staff (aside from Henry) are all friendly, attractive women who know what they are doing - and the tea and coffee selection will rival anywhere else. Plus, it's an independent store that does things the right way. (Love the brown sugar for the coffee.) Can't recommend it enough - it's a treat for anyone in the Outer Sunset.
author: Matthew G.

description: if you love coffee, you need to come here.  the pastries suck, and there isn't much atmosphere in the place, but the coffee is phenomenal, so rich and flavorful!  the women who work here are incredibly friendly and professional.  this is the best cup of coffee i've had in the city.  try the bella finka.
author: eileen k.
